columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the value of the company's share price while evaluating whether the method of stock evaluation is appropriate.

Before we start solving for the current share price of the company, we must first list down the given values that will be relevant in the solution:


| Current dividend|$3.40 | 
|--|--| 
|Required rate of return |10.5% | 
| Growth rate|3.8% |

Since only the current dividend is given, we will solve for the new dividend using this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{New dividend}&=\text{Current dividend} \times (1+\text{Growth rate})
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{New dividend}&=\$3.40 \times (1+0.038)\\[15 pt]
&=\$3.53
\end{aligned}$$

The new dividend will be $\$3.53$.

Since we already have the new dividend, we can solve for the current share price of the company using the formula in Step 2:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Current share price}&=\dfrac{\$3.53}{0.105-0.038}\\[15 pt]
&=\$52.69
\end{aligned}$$

The current share price of the company is $\$52.69$.

**b.** For this part of the problem, we will assume that the company pays quarterly dividends. We will still use the same concept as we did with part **a**. The given values for this are:

| Current quarterly dividend|$0.85 | 
|--|--| 
|Required rate of return |10.5% | 
| Growth rate|3.8% |

Now we need to get the new quarterly dividend using the formula in Step 4.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{New quarterly dividend}&=\$0.85 \times (1+0.038)\\[15 pt]
&=\$0.88
\end{aligned}$$

The new quarterly dividend is $\$0.88$.

Before we are able solve for the current share price, we must first solve for the effective quarterly rate using this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Effective quarterly rate}&=(1+\text{Required rate of return})^\frac{1}{\text{Number of periods}}-1
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Effective quarterly rate}&=(1+0.105)^\frac{1}{4}-1\\[15 pt]
&=0.02528
\end{aligned}$$

This means that the effective quarterly rate is $0.02528$ or $2.528\%$.

From the effective quarterly rate, we can solve for the effective annual end-of-year dividend. To do this, we will use this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Effective annual dividend}&=\dfrac{\text{New quarterly dividend}}{\text{Effective quaterly rate}}\times[(1+\text{Effective quarterly rate})^{\text{Number of periods}}-1
\end{aligned}$$

Substituting the values, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Effective annual dividend}&=\dfrac{\$0.88}{0.02528}\times[(1+0.02528)^4-1]\\[15 pt]
&=\$3.66
\end{aligned}$$

The effective annual end-of-year dividend of this is $\$3.66$.

Now we can use the formula in Step 2 to solve for the share price of the company. However, we will use the effective annual end-of-year dividend as the value for the dividend in the solution.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Current share price}&=\dfrac{\$3.66}{0.105-0.038}\\[15 pt]
&=\$54.63
\end{aligned}$$

The current share price for this is $\$54.63$.
The second method is more appropriate since it takes into consideration that the dividend grows quarterly, which allows it to make an adjustment on the current share price of the company's stock.
